chargeHist.descr: Deliver Methamphetamine within 1000 feet of park-2nd or subsequent offense (<=3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond A. ROGERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Methamphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentences imposed on 16 CF 194, 15 CF 270 and the sentences presently being served on Sheboygan County case no: 15 CF 392 and 15 CF 324.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

No contact with any known drug dealers or users.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.   The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with any known drug users or distributors and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
